intro: Nesaea winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's nesaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Nesaea winkleri is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
